figure_2.title: Figure 2. Prevalence of Obesity in ages 60 years and older using National Health and Nutrition Examination Surveys over the past 4 decades based on body mass index. Current estimates indicate that obesity is present in men in 37.5% and 39.4% in females in the population.
figure_2.caption: Data from Flegal KM, Kruszon-Moran D, Carroll MD, et al. Trends in Obesity Among Adults in the United States, 2005 to 2014. JAMA 2016;315(21):2284â€“2291.

claims.sentence:
Keywords: obesity, older adult, weight loss, physical function, pharmacotherapy, bariatric surgery, reviewEpidemiology of Aging & Obesity
By the year 2030 in the United States, over 20% of the population will be over the age of 65 years1 (Figure 1), up from 15% of the population today2.
Recent estimates from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Surveys demonstrate that adults over age 60 have obesity rates exceeding 37.5% in males and 39.4% in females12 (Figure 2).

Keywords: obesity, older adult, weight loss, physical function, pharmacotherapy, bariatric surgery, reviewEpidemiology of Aging & Obesity
